Dictionary.description: -- Definition -- Functions of road nodes within Euroroads.

Definition.description:
-- Definition -- The road node is situated inside and/or represents an enclosed traffic area. A traffic area is an area with no internal structure of legally defined driving directions. At least two roads are connected to the area..
-- Description -- SOURCE [Euroroads].
Definition.name: enclosedTrafficArea

Definition.description: -- Definition -- Three or more road links intersect at the road node.
Definition.name: junction

Definition.description: -- Definition -- A railway crosses a road on the same level at the position of the road node.
Definition.name: levelCrossing

Definition.description: -- Definition -- Exactly two road links connect to the road node.
Definition.name: pseudoNode

Definition.description: -- Definition -- Only one road link connects to the road node. It signifies the end of a road.
Definition.name: roadEnd

Definition.description: -- Definition -- The road node represents or is a part of a roundabout.
Definition.name: roundabout

Definition.description:
-- Definition -- The road node is situated inside and/or represents a traffic square. A traffic square is an area (partly) enclosed by roads which is used for non-traffic purposes and which is not a roundabout.
-- Description -- SOURCE [GDF, Euroroads].
Definition.name: trafficSquare

Definition.description:
-- Definition -- Surface annexed to a road and devoted to offer particular services for it.
-- Description -- EXAMPLES Gas station, rest area, toll area.
Definition.name: roadServiceArea
